name: Hilton Garden Inn Minneapolis Downtown

reviews.text: First off, let me just say, I was blown away by the friendly helpful staff we encountered at the front desk, housekeeping and restaurant/bar. This property obviously puts a heavy emphasis on hiring quality, people-oriented personnel and spends time training them on customer service.
reviews.title: Wonderful staff in every department

reviews.text: Arriving by shuttle from the airport we walked into a very welcoming lobby. The fresh-baked cookies were just out of the oven and set on the 24-hour beverage station which also included coffee, teas, hot chocolate and my favorite, a large dispenser with lemon-ice water. A note about the cookies though, if you weren't in the lobby RIGHT when the cookies were put out, you didn't get any. We only saw crumbs the rest of our 3 night stay. We also enjoyed the complimentary USA Today and Minneapolis Star Tribunes with our coffee by the fireplace in the mornings.
reviews.title: Double Check your reservation

reviews.text: Our accomodations were a typical clean, modern and comfortable Garden Inn room. They touted the adjustable beds but we were never able to determine a difference in any of the settings. The heating/air conditioner was extremely quiet but the touch-electronics to operate it were frustratingly non-responsive most of the time. Loved the spacious walk-in shower in the bathroom. Our first morning, the seal on the door had failed and flooded the bathroom floor. One mention to the front desk and it was fixed immediately and followed up with a nice note and chocolate from the maintenance engineer.
reviews.title: Clean, comfortable and convenient

reviews.text: The location of the property was just okay for us as tourists and not convention attendees. We did not have a car and so relied on public transportation and foot-power to see the city. It was only about 2 blocks to the massive skywalk system and about 4 blocks to Nicollete Ave. where you can catch the free transportation up and down this area. Unless you wanted to take the buses, you had quite a hike to some of the sights, but it certainly can be done if you are at all mobile.I would have liked a few more restaurant choices closer in for dinner. We did have dinner at the hotel the first night and it was just fine but not memorable. We opted out of breakfast because we are light morning eaters and the only option was a $12.95 buffet.
reviews.title: Great downtown hotel

reviews.text: All things considered, we really did enjoy our stay here.
reviews.title: Hotel for wedding party and guests

reviews.text: Good amenities. Good lounge. Great customer service.
reviews.title: Parking is Atrocious. No Late Night Food.

reviews.text: But be prepared to pay $24 for valet parking. Your option is to walk two blocks. Not a good idea if carrying a laptop bag at night. I was confronted by a panhandler on the way to my car. There are three "15 minutes parking only", spots in front of the hotel. One is for handicapped. The hotel posts the phone number of the towing company that will take your car. They obviously have no problem having your car towed.
reviews.title: did not live up to hype

reviews.text: Care for a late night hot dish? You are out of luck. There is nothing within walking distance. There is a Target nearby, so buy some food that you can nuke later.
reviews.title: So friendly and very convenient

reviews.text: On my next trip to MSP, I will stay closer to the suburbs.
reviews.title: Agree with others that this is number one!

reviews.text: We picked this for a getaway in the city because we are loyal Hilton members and that it was the number one hotel in Minneapolis. We really did not experience anything close to that in our stay. Our bathroom, although very clean, reeked of smoke and the lamp broke as I was using it and had to pull the plug from the wall in order to turn it off. Not acceptable at all. The upside was that the staff were all great and very friendly.
reviews.title: Good downtown berth

reviews.text: Very good. Overall good experience. Very clean. The price is very good with the quality. I have come to this Hotel twice this year for business trip and like it very much. Looking forward to come back again.
reviews.title: Hilton Garden Inn

reviews.text: My girlfriend and I stayed here and had a great time! The service was awesome! Everyone was really nice. All smiles and very informative. The rooms are affordable and spacious. If we pass through Minneapolis again we will be staying here. Thanks guys for a great stay!
reviews.title: Fantastic

reviews.text: Having never stayed at the "Garden Inn" chain of Hilton, I must admit that I am not very impressed. On the surface the facility was nothing extraordinary, tucked in an obscure corner of downtown; one positive is the facility is very close to the convention center.
reviews.title: Nothing Special

reviews.text: Staying four days/nights, my room was clean and the facility had a nice decor. Issues I had with the hotel included: No room safe; traveling with expensive computers, etc., it would be nice to have the option to secure my valuables as I've I've had items pilfered in the past. A fridge and microwave are in the room, but there are no plates/bowls or utensils in the event you did want to eat your leftovers from the day before? With a full-service restaurant on-site, you would think that providing cutlery and 'real' glasses shouldn't be such an issue since they're washing dishes anyway; having a cocktail in your room out of a paper cup is rather unappealing. I did eat breakfast in the restaurant which is presented as a "buffet"; it is necessary to order anything that has to be cooked (eggs, bacon, etc.) and the remainder is put out for folks to help themselves.
reviews.title: Business Trip

reviews.text: Another issue I found annoying was the lack of taxi service. Located in an out-of-the-way corner, all of the taxi traffic flow bypasses the hotel. They do offer a limo service which I used to the airport, but even at the $45 flat fee is more expensive than a regular taxi ride (I payed less for my cab fare from the airport to the hotel)!
reviews.title: Nicer than most Hilton Garden Inns, friendly staff

reviews.text: This hotel is Wonderful! I stayed for 6 nights and had no complaints at all. (except that the indoor pool was a bit cool) I would recommend this hotel to anyone. All the staff I encountered over the course of my stay were friendly and very helpful, Josh, Amy, Carlos, & Alona to name only a few of the names I could remember. It is very close to the convention center, and was easy to walk there. Rooms were clean, with all your typical amenity's. WiFi is included and they offer a shuttle to the light rail if you want to get out to the mall or anywhere in between. You wont be sorry if you choose to stay here. Thanks for a great stay HGI staff!!!
reviews.title: This hotel is not ranked #1 for NO reason!!

reviews.text: Overall excellent, great stay! Clean nicely decorated rooms with beautiful views, friendly and efficient staff, convenient location , internet works perfectly, also able to print our boarding passes for machine in lobby!
reviews.title: Travel Consultant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A standard Hilton Hotel room; quiet; clean and well presented ...... but superbly located for the city centre and access to restaurants; shops; Target Field (Twins Baseball) etc. Very helpful staff, especially the front desk.
reviews.title: Conveniently Located

reviews.text: The lobby is inviting, the valets doing the doors are very friendly, and the rooms were nice and quite large. The people checking me in where pleasant and friendly and efficient I asked for an extra blanket and one was delivered immediately. This hotel is 1 block from the convention center which was an easy walk. However, if you are going to a convention during bad weather months, I'd consider a hotel that is hooked to the covered walkway. I rode the light rail from the airport to the Government Plaza exit, turned right on 4th Street and walked 6 blocks to 11th street and the hotel. This was an easy and cheap way to get downtown from the airport. The walk was also easy. This hotel is about 4 blocks away from Nicollette Mall which has great restaurants and outdoor seating and various shopping opportunities. I was concerned as the hotel is located on an off-ramp, but it was very quiet. The beds were great, the bathroom was nice. I would definitely stay here again if the weather cooperated!!!!
reviews.title: A great hotel for doing a convention in downtown

reviews.text: I've stayed at the Hilton Garden Inn in Downtown Minneapolis several times and I've never been disappointed. From valet parking to check in, as well as internet service and room service, it's always a great stay.
reviews.title: Good Stay

aka: Hilton Garden Inn Minneapolis Downtown Hotel
description: Come and join us in the heart of downtown Minneapolis’ corporations and entertainment districts at Hilton Garden Inn Minneapolis Downtown. You’ll be within walking distance to the exciting Nicollet Mall shopping and just one block from Minneapolis Convention Center. Visit the Walker Art Center or see a show at the Orchestra Hall. Stay in a spacious guest room at this downtown Minneapolis hotel, all of which feature contemporary decor and include complimentary high-speed internet access. Stay energized with the hotel's indoor swimming pool and keep up with your routine with the modern cardiovascular machines and weights in our fitness center. Start each day with a delicious cooked-to-order breakfast at the Great American Grill® restaurant, or pick up supplies at the 24-hour Pavilion Pantry® convenience store.
